title: German Tofu (firm) with Baby potatoes & Onion
hydrationTip: Add 300–500 ml water with the meal; spicy meals may need a little extra.
method: Heat olive oil in a large pan over medium-high heat.
Cook tofu (firm) 6–8 min until done; remove.
Stir-fry onion and carrots with italian herbs 19 min; season.
Return protein to warm through 1–2 min.
Cook baby potatoes until tender (20–25 min boiled).
Plate the carb base, add vegetables, top with protein; drizzle remaining pan juices.
swaps: Use chicken breast instead of plant protein for an omnivore option.
Use Baby potatoes or switch to cauliflower rice for lower carbs.
Spice tweak: add fresh chilli for more heat or reduce spice blend for mild.

title: Green beans & Courgette Bulgur wheat with Paneer
hydrationTip: Add 300–500 ml water with the meal; spicy meals may need a little extra.
method: Preheat grill to high.
Heat ghee in a large pan over medium-high heat.
Cook paneer 6–8 min until done; remove.
Stir-fry green beans and courgette with lemon & herb 10 min; season.
Return protein to warm through 1–2 min.
Cook the bulgur wheat according to pack; drain well.
Plate the carb base, add vegetables, top with protein; drizzle remaining pan juices.
swaps: Use chicken breast instead of plant protein for an omnivore option.
Use Bulgur wheat or switch to cauliflower rice for lower carbs.
Spice tweak: add fresh chilli for more heat or reduce spice blend for mild.

title: Prawns Harissa plate
hydrationTip: Add 300–500 ml water with the meal; spicy meals may need a little extra.
method: Preheat the oven to 200°C.
Toss peppers and cherry tomatoes with half the ghee, salt, pepper and harissa; spread on a tray.
Season prawns and place on the tray. Roast for 48 min, turning once.
Cook baby potatoes until tender (18–25 min roasted).
Plate the carb base, add vegetables, top with protein; drizzle remaining pan juices.
swaps: Swap Prawns for tofu to make it vegetarian.
Use Baby potatoes or switch to cauliflower rice for lower carbs.
Spice tweak: add fresh chilli for more heat or reduce spice blend for mild.

Spice tweak: add fresh chilli for more heat or reduce spice blend for mild.

Spice tweak: add fresh chilli for more heat or reduce spice blend for mild.

title: Cod fillet Cajun blend plate
hydrationTip: Add 300–500 ml water with the meal; spicy meals may need a little extra.
method: Heat walnuts in a large pan over medium-high heat.
Cook cod fillet 3–4 min until done; remove.
Stir-fry green beans and aubergine with cajun blend 32 min; season.
Return protein to warm through 1–2 min.
Cook the whole-wheat pasta according to pack; drain well.
Plate the carb base, add vegetables, top with protein; drizzle remaining pan juices.
swaps: Swap Cod for tofu to make it vegetarian.
Use Whole-wheat pasta or switch to cauliflower rice for lower carbs.
Spice tweak: add fresh chilli for more heat or reduce spice blend for mild.

title: Tunisian Chicken breast traybake
hydrationTip: Add 300–500 ml water with the meal; spicy meals may need a little extra.
method: Heat ghee in a large pan over medium-high heat.
Cook chicken breast 6–8 min until done; remove.
Stir-fry broccoli and mushrooms with lemon & herb 24 min; season.
Return protein to warm through 1–2 min.
Cook the couscous according to pack; drain well.
Plate the carb base, add vegetables, top with protein; drizzle remaining pan juices.
swaps: Swap Chicken for tofu to make it vegetarian.
Use Couscous or switch to cauliflower rice for lower carbs.
Spice tweak: add fresh chilli for more heat or reduce spice blend for mild.

title: Peruvian Chickpeas wrap
hydrationTip: Add 300–500 ml water with the meal; spicy meals may need a little extra.
method: Heat rapeseed oil in a large pan over medium-high heat.
Cook chickpeas 6–8 min until done; remove.
Stir-fry peppers and onion with cajun blend 12 min; season.
Return protein to warm through 1–2 min.
Plate the carb base, add vegetables, top with protein; drizzle remaining pan juices.
swaps: Use chicken breast instead of plant protein for an omnivore option.
Use Pitta or switch to cauliflower rice for lower carbs.
Spice tweak: add fresh chilli for more heat or reduce spice blend for mild.

title: Chinese Chickpeas traybake
hydrationTip: Add 300–500 ml water with the meal; spicy meals may need a little extra.
method: Prepare the fresh components on a board.
Mix chickpeas with ras el hanout and a pinch of salt.
Layer with garlic, peppers and couscous.
Cook the couscous according to pack; drain well.
Plate the carb base, add vegetables, top with protein; drizzle remaining pan juices.
swaps: Use chicken breast instead of plant protein for an omnivore option.
Use Couscous or switch to cauliflower rice for lower carbs.
Spice tweak: add fresh chilli for more heat or reduce spice blend for mild.

title: French Protein Egg Bites with Aubergine
hydrationTip: Add 300–500 ml water with the meal; spicy meals may need a little extra.
method: Heat walnuts in a large pan over medium-high heat.
Cook eggs 6–8 min until done; remove.
Stir-fry aubergine and broccoli with cajun blend 30 min; season.
Return protein to warm through 1–2 min.
Cook the brown rice according to pack; drain well.
Plate the carb base, add vegetables, top with protein; drizzle remaining pan juices.
swaps: Use chicken breast instead of plant protein for an omnivore option.
Use Brown rice or switch to cauliflower rice for lower carbs.
Spice tweak: add fresh chilli for more heat or reduce spice blend for mild.

title: Polish Tuna (canned) with Pitta & Green beans
hydrationTip: Add 300–500 ml water with the meal; spicy meals may need a little extra.
method: Preheat the air fryer to 180°C.
Toss green beans and peppers with half the rapeseed oil, salt, pepper and smoked paprika + cumin; spread on a tray.
Season tuna (canned) and place on the tray. Air-fry for 41 min, turning once.
Plate the carb base, add vegetables, top with protein; drizzle remaining pan juices.
swaps: Swap Tuna for tofu to make it vegetarian.
Use Pitta or switch to cauliflower rice for lower carbs.
Spice tweak: add fresh chilli for more heat or reduce spice blend for mild.
